definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

sentences.english: Man allegedly shocks stepdaughter with dog collar .
sentences.chinese: 繼父用狗的電子項圈電擊繼女。

sentences.english: But I do not mean to give you the idea that talk is all it takes to be a good parent or stepparent.
sentences.chinese: 但我的意思並非只要交談就能當好父母或繼父繼母。

sentences.english: My step-dad said she only drinks on the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我的繼父補充說，她只要週末才喝酒。

sentences.english: But my mom and stepdad were really into making events out of special days of the year.” My friend June smiled at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 不過我媽和繼父很喜歡在特殊的日子裏搞些花樣。

sentences.english: Ray is my new step dad.
Yingzi dreams about Uncle An becoming her step-father.
sentences.chinese: 櫻子非常希望安伯伯成爲她的繼父。

sentences.english: So www. e even www. couldn't get a proper stepfather for her.
sentences.chinese: 我爲女兒感到遺憾，她媽媽不能爲她找個好繼父。

sentences.english: They grew up in one-parent families or with stepmothers and stepfathers.
sentences.chinese: 他們在單親家庭里長大或是繼父繼母帶大的。
他的繼父給了他很多指導。

sentences.english: Article 21. Maltreatment and discrimination shall not be allowed between step-parents and step-children.
sentences.chinese: 第二十一條繼父母與繼子女間，不得虐待或歧視。

sentences.english: I also felt the need to speak out about the detrimental effect I felt my step-parents had had on my life.
sentences.chinese: 我還感到需要訴說自己一生中對繼父母所造成的傷害。

sentences.english: The stepfamily he was given to had a son older than Christian.
sentences.chinese: 他繼父母家了還有一個比他大的男孩。

sentences.english: Her stepfather married her to Menelaus, king of Sparta.
sentences.chinese: 海倫的繼父將她嫁給了斯巴達的國王墨涅勞斯。

sentences.english: Her nightmare begun from there onwards and her step father continue raping her till today.
sentences.chinese: 從此噩夢開始了，繼父長期霸佔她至今。

sentences.english: In order to live, two years later, mother and married my stepfather.
sentences.chinese: 爲了生活，兩年後母親又改嫁給了我現在的繼父。

sentences.english: It can be pretty tough when your parents or stepparents are fighting.
sentences.chinese: 父母或者繼父母爭吵時，情況可能相當棘手。

definition: adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
